324vXViVDfStsvTovsTE5Q.text: Great atmosphere! We went on a Friday night but didn't feel crowded even though there were many people there. The service was good and the food was great! I got the chipotle shrimp tacos and it was amazing! Highly Recommend.

mNFHJhRryZcE3SeSoNYVUA.text: Bottomline: It is the equivalent of ballpark hotdog - overpriced and underwhelming.   We had dinner before a big show. I had the cheese quesadillas and my GF had a taco plate. Three things stuck out from the experience:   1) Quality of food. To be blunt, I've had cafeteria food that was more appetizing. If anything stood out on my plate, it was the browning lettuce strips on the side. The quesadillas were underwhelming. The sour cream was ok but runny, and it filled only a 1/4 of the tiny plastic cup. The taco plate had three small tacos with two big cups of rice and beans obviously designed to fill you up.  2) Service. The waitress was nice but apparently unprepared. She couldn't recall the seasonal beers on tap. We had to ask her to bring us several things after the meal was delivered: 1) water, 2) salsa for the meal, and 3) extra sour cream.  3)  Menu. Here I was mystified as there were not a lot of distinct choices. I appreciate reducing costs and having a simple menu, but many of the dishes stated they had rice and beens in them, which also happens to also accompany the dish!

vViur3hlA6AyL8-lwOijAg.text: My boys and i got kicked out because they were making room for more women , and after we paid 10$ to see murda beats , and then they lied about us being roughy we go there every friday to turn up and the fact that we got kicked out for no reason at all after i was with a table is outrageous, it was a giant waste of money , thanks for that i really would like to speak to the manager because this is literally the worst thing ever, how could you could the guys who come and promote you every weekend out . If the manager could contact me that would be highly appreciated thank you

iaospPVUgct_-ofkuffC-g.text: We had the worst server trying to give us our tickets. Everything was wrong and we spent over 30 minutes trying to get it right. She didn't get a manager to help, which she should have. Everything was great until we had to pay. This ruined the whole night. Please get better servers who know what they're doing.

yPTJyvIIauL7UPG0PEou8g.text: If I could give less than one star, I would.  We have eaten in some great places while here for the Fiesta Bowl, but this was not one of them.  If this was a review of the waiter, I would give 5 stars, but the food was awful.  First of all, they could not produce the margaritas we ordered because they ran out.  Strike one.  We ordered beer instead and they compensated by upsizing.  We ordered a trio, and it was delivered to the table next to us.  Strike two.  When the trio finally arrived, the queso was so watered down it was like the consistency of milk.  Finally the entrees arrived and they were lukewarm.  Strike three.  The tamales tasted like Texas BBQ meat with BBQ sauce poured on top.  If there was cumin or cilantro seasoning, it was well hidden.  I was taught to never leave food on your plate, but they were so bad there was no way to finish.  The ONLY bright spot was that the waiter tried really hard to make it all OK.  This was LSU headquarters for the game.  True tigers fans who can cook great dishes would have never picked this place if they sampled the food first.  Even great staff can't make up for crappy food!

Hq0Hbg79nDnCzhhzE2RsRA.text: Wow! What a difference a few weeks made with my experience. The management and staff were overly attentive and my server Shanie was awesome. Always smiling and appeared to love what she's doing.  Food was amazing. Full of flavor and, honestly, I couldn't eat it all because the portions were more than I could eat. While I didn't order dessert this time, I'm happy to be back. I'm not from this part of the country but will definitely make the effort next time I'm here to come back. Great job management and staff. Well done.

b6LZV4yIEhKTy_uLmzoNNQ.text: Brought to you by the same guy who owns Whiskey Rose next door.  Salt is being touted as a modern Mexican food joint.  It is located in the old Margaritaville spot in the center of Westgate (aka Restaurant Cemetery).  I tried the shrimp ceviche a carne asada quesadilla.    The ceviche had pieces of zucchini in it and was a good size.  But it did not taste freshly made and was overpowered with lime juice.  It needed some heat and less citrus.  It was 14 bucks for about a cup and came with chips on the side.    The carne asada quesadilla was a good size and came with a tomatillo salsa on the side.  The tomatillo salsa was not good.  It needed more spices and heat.  The quesadilla was good but could have been better if they served it with a pico de gallo and sour cream or guac.  I believe it was $13.  The service was pretty good.  The place was dead right after training camp so that was a bad sign.    The beer menu was lousy.  Closest thing to craft was Big Wave by Kona.  Any modern place should have some modern beer no?  I'd take authentic Mexican food or street Mexican food with fresh chips and salsa anytime over this.  For the price, product, and beer selection I really don't think I'd have a reason to come back here.  Westgate has a collaboration of some of the most mediocre restaurant offerings in the valley unfortunately.  They could use some new blood.

5rutS8prkNB0WtMeJZiwcg.text: If you want crappy food and even crappier service with complimentary excuses, this is the place for you!!!

SOdfkxBRUcj3Z65SMx3gMg.text: We went to an event as part of a conference here.  The margaritas were great and the view from the second floor was awesome.

T6kNuT-rQLHKnOZ_N82E8g.text: I came here after the Mcgregor/Mayweather fight for a friends bday and another friends "going away" party. He had 2 VIP tables reserved. When we got there, it seemed like a fun place. Pretty spacious, the music was good, and all my friends were there. Well, as soon as the bottles came, they were gone since we had so many people in our section.  I resorted to getting my own drinks at the bar. My first issue was when my brother ordered 2 shots from the Asian girl at the bar on the second floor. As soon as she poured them and put them on the bar for us, my other friend quickly showed up and wanted a shot as well. I put my finger in the air and mouthed "one more please". She rolled her eyes, threw her arms up and mouthed "really?!".  We all looked at each other kind of shocked.  This was the first time EVER that I did not leave a tip.  Second issue was with the crowd that this bar/club attracts. A lot of "westside thugs". I know it's not the clubs fault but mix these type of guys with liquor and you'll have some problems. We were constantly "mad dogged" and shoved until my brother almost got into a fight with a really drunk up-to-no-good thug. This happened at the front patio. We were trying to get in between the 2 to prevent a fight. Security was nowhere to be found for assistance. Finally, we left at 2am. As we got to the parking lot, there was TONS of fights. I mean EVERYONE was fighting. Get bartenders with good/fun attitudes and make security more present INSIDE the bar and it would be better. For now, we won't be returning.

BrTCTCVvO0iwrL_ZZUptVw.text: Good place for some tasty nachos. Situated across from the Gila River Arena. Nice view of the fountains for outside seating. Watch out, the bathroom has an attendant in the evenings. She's super nice at least.  My friend and I ordered carnitas nachos and beers. The nachos were on a huge platter. And delicious with more than enough for two. Meat was shredded and tender, not stringy. Cheese sauce was good and a little spicy. Came with sour cream, salsa and jalapenos. Only reason they get 4 stars was that our order of nachos was dry inside. Once we ate the top, we were left with chips. After I pointed this out to the server, he right away got us more queso fundido. Perfect. Server was really attentive. Actually all the servers were really nice. Bartenders were great when I asked them for beer and shot combo suggestions. Beer on tap was typical of a Mexican restaurant.  The place becomes a dance club on weekends so they were clearing out tables as we ate, but we never felt rushed to leave.

6NwKoSTtFwQYupl0ACAhVg.text: Slow service, terrible margaritas,  I ordered Tres Generations it tasted like Cuervo, had the headache to prove it. Taco salad had lots of lettuce a good taco bowl and lots of lettuce. Chips and salsa were very good.

x6rhKNiY1SzqpvGO30D3Ew.text: Rating: - 1  Should have listened to Yelp!! This place was so bad I sent the Fried Ice Cream back. How do you ruin ice cream? Salt did. As for dinner, the Adobo Chicken was so dry and over cooked. Wish I would have sent that back. They could have recycled into an army boot sole. Items missing that were asked for in the Bowls. Service was very slow. But I blame that on management.  Our table of 7 had our food delivered one plate at a time.

oYKFem1lMtyOkgigcuZbqQ.text: Don't bother spending your money at this manufactured, wannabe trendy, low budget, over priced shitbox. You'll leave feeling like a sucker. It took an hour to get our food (when it wasn't even busy) and it was NOTHING special. My $16 fajitas were comprised of a chicken breast, sloppy soft green bell pepper slivers and onion. My girlfriends $15 tacos looked like they were for a toddler they were so small and crappy. The trendy club music was just dumb, and the service was shit...

hknh0JV0M2kAlxGDisxb0Q.text: DO NOT COME HERE!  Came for "Sunday Funday", left feeling sick and disguisted. No games as advertised or even a reasonable size menu for their "brunch". The fruit that was brought to my 4 year old son was rotten! When I mentioned this to our waitress, I was told, "that cant be possible, we cut our fruit only on sundays when its the brunch menu and I smelled the watermelon and it was fine." Ok, I said, well it was the green melon not the watermelon and could it be possible that your cooks cut up a rotten melon? She stated, "Well, I dont eat melon so I dont know what its supposed to smell or taste like." Really.......good lord! First of all dont argue with your customers and second of all, apologize, get a manager and ask how you can help, not antagonize us! I still gave one star because the music playing, which was the only thing True to their advertisement, was great as well as their french toast. But never again will I or my friends and family go again and trust me, Ive already mentioned this to plenty of people.

R0mtBxL7xfYfhjXFFHgX7g.text: The food was good, margaritas were tasty. Service was as bad as it gets. Our waitress had a pocket full of excuses.

PKm44FDYnKCHEojyf_f1ew.text: Visiting from out of town - this place was recommended- was very disappointing- not good Mexican food at alll" -our party of 5 all had different items- paying for chips and salsa is joke first of all salsa had no flavor - chips were not fresh- on to drinks- all had different margaritas - two each. Very little a alcohol- Dinner carnitas burrito bland with burnt meat - ceded plank salmon- no seasoning- will not go back- do not recommend

6ZnxuY4-Eee7WQPnUJ22fg.text: My first and very last time coming here. ACvARZqCH6LvAtmwyyk95Q.text: First time there went before the Beyonce concert for drinks and food we got nachos which were like $16 we each got margaritas which were like $11 we got our nachos and there was a grey hair in it we also ordered shots of tequila so when waitress came we told her about the nachos with the hair she looked grossed out as we were she came back with fresh ones (makes me wonder if they gave us the same ones again but freshened it up) then tells us they were out of the tequila shots we wanted ....so hair in our nachos , no tequila shots we wanted and not to mention our drinks were in extremely small disposable plastic cups which the price we paid for them were priced too high for what we got and she didn't even give us a deal on the darn nachos .....will never go back if I could do a negative star I would but thank goodness for social media my sister took pictures of the hair and our child size drinks !!!!!! not worth the money at all we should've stuck with going to McFadden's but decided to give this a try

VqLng0YhbFERRzyQSEX8HA.text: Expensive. But the guacamole and the margaritas were definitely worth it. Our server was sweet and not too overbearing when we just asked for chips and guac and lots of drinks. I got the original margarita and it was strong and VERY good. Four stars only for the price and that it took them a while to notice us at the front.

Xk0DYBLJC1YJ7H9Mu-tULw.text: Great shots awesome Don Julio 1942 shot! Food is excellent, the nachos and burrito are really good

X_SAr3B2FXMB9jXSZR2myA.text: Came here recently with a few friends that I had not seen in a long time and we were completely disappointed by our experience.  When I arrived there, it took about 15-20 minutes for the bartender to take my order. I ended up ordering two drinks for myself because I didn't want to spend so much time waiting at the bar again. It's understandable that it was a busy night but I have never waited this long at places on Mill and in Old Town.  After that, my friends decided to head to the dance floor. One of them was talking to another guy and exchanging contact information when suddenly a security guard came up and asked them to walk outside. Now, I was there the ENTIRE time. My friend and the guy were doing absolutely nothing wrong. Followed them out and I realized that they were getting kicked out. The reason? Because they were talking. That's literally what security told us. God forbid people actually SOCIALIZE in a bar/club setting. No one was intoxicated. We respectfully asked why and tried to explain how that wasn't fair but they wouldn't budge and even called on West Gate's security to intervene.  I'm still baffled as of to why this happened. I read other reviews where people have gotten kicked out for no reason whatsoever. What's up with that? I went to Salt frequently and never had issues up until this point. I won't be going anymore if that's how their staff will treat customers.

bjg5K1iu40PjiV7c9BSm0w.text: We came to grab a quick bite to eat before the Coyotes hockey game. It was quick service and surprisingly delicious food!! We ordered the Green Chili Enchilada, Chicken Quesadilla, Chips & Salsa and the Half Nachos. I absolutely loved the enchilada and am already craving more. The Half Nachos ended up being a heaping plateful of nachos so we are curious as to how many people it would take to eat the Full Nachos. Luckily the 4 of us tackled the Half. Great food for great prices and fun ambiance! Will definitely come back for the future hockey games I come out for :)

XEdM69RKEBvExZdKxIRAPQ.text: Don't want to expend too much energy on this place so I will get to the specifics...  We walked in at happy hour and didn't even get asked if we wanted anything off the happy hour drunk or food menu.  Douchey big guy in a STT walking around being a "bro" rather than helping the place run.  Can't tell who the servers are because there's no uniform or name tags easily seen.  The only way we picked them out was they all had the same trendy, hipster black rim glasses.    We had a variety of tacos and nothing to write home about.  Highlight of the meal was the habanero salsa.   Tamales with chicken and verde sauce looked great but lacked meat and flavor.  They use cubed chicken which is odd because usually it's shredded....seemed like that's where the flavor usually happens is in the braised meat.   Good try STT.... Maybe you will get a manager in place to whip that place into shape and make it rock outside of the nightclub hours.

zwLwD5K-eMqyWVMCjwnEoQ.text: Danielle and Jessa two VIP bottle girls are pretty amazing people. They're always fun and friendly and when it comes to the bottle service their service is top notch. It's actually the best. To anyone going to Salt for a good night out ask for those two because they'll definitely make the experience worth it.

3Z4IEfMSxOE8cNQ2HGwhyg.text: Blood Orange Margarita was delish! Shrimp tacos a guacamole were fabulous! If you are near Cardinal Stadium you must check them out!

MewBaoflJDXbsuKYjQwpTQ.text: I've been here for lunch a few times. I am currently working my way around the menu. Mostly everything is worth trying a 2nd time.

PASPwqFZ1UQ0fpAN-_ND0g.text: Little disappointed. I was in Glendale for a weekend trip. My cousins and I figure its close to our hotel and figure we would eat here for lunch.  We both had the taco salad, and we both agreed its missing some ingredients. So much so that we actually took what was missing from her daughter's plate to mix it up a little. The atmosphere is beautiful and the Marquita helped. Neither of us finished the salad except for the shell, my little cousin was picking on our shell as well as she did not finish her meal.

McQkyWbJ_juA_kPmstw_UQ.text: This is really a 2 1/2 star establishment. The service is VERY slow. The manger did not do much to help. The bar tender was jamming on making the drinks but she was the only one that worked fast.  The chicken burrito was good.  My husband had to wait quite some time to have bottled beer delivered to our table. The waitress just wanted to give us our check and get rid of us. Twin peaks restaurant was in the same vicinity and we highly recommend their establishment. Salt restaurant you should step up your game. Your competition is surpassing you in quality, service, and customer satisfaction.

JHWGU_12lrLjiitIcm8IEw.text: So great! We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the weather with some tacos and the taco salad. The potato tacos are some of the best I've had and the taco salad was very large. It was all excellent we will definitely be back!

nuK7HwCVe4m90dMlSiotsQ.text: I REALLY wanted to like this place. We went back last night wanting to take advantage of their taco Tuesday deals that we saw advertised. We were on our way back from an event, and I called to see what time they closed. I was told they closed at 2am. I hung up the phone and realized that they probably stop serving food earlier, so I called back and asked what time the kitchen closes, and I was told 11pm. Perfect.  So we head that way, and the a-frame sign advertising taco Tuesday is still outside. The security guy up front checked our ID and we went in, but there was no one at the hostess stand, so my husband asked the guy where we should sit if we want food. He said to sit anywhere. We went and picked a table and waited for a few minutes. A man who I am assuming was the manager came over and let us know that the kitchen was closing at 10pm and if we wanted to order food he could have them make it before they closed. It was a few minutes to 10pm. I told him I had just called and I was told it was open until 11pm, but that we could just leave if they were closing. We drove 30+ minutes down to Westgate to give the place another try because they said they would be open, and ended up eating at YardHouse instead. SO disappointing. We really liked their food and drinks last time, but service was the issue. It seems like that is still the theme and I wish that wasn't the case. If they're not open late, it's not a big deal - but the staff informing me of that when I called to ask 30 minutes before we got there would have saved a lot of frustration for us. The only redeeming event last night was that the manager was extremely nice and offered to accommodate us even though it would inconvenience them. He also responded to my last review offering to have us come in again, which was very nice - although I never took him up on it, and I wish I had, because I'm sure we would have had a better experience.

ECqcEYuQja6RLYjW1VBxmA.text: stopped in to try some place new. Horrible service. Hostesses were nice and friendly, sat promptly.Waiter sucked....took forever to order a beer, didn't know happy hour special, didn't know ingredients for the menu. Ordered chips and salsa and guacamole. took 15 minutes to get. He stopped by to let me know that he was waiting on the kitchen to cook the guacamole. After waiting an additional 10 minutes, waiting to order a 2nd beer, he finally.came by. after another 5 to 10 minutes came by to let me know he was waiting on the bar for the beer maybe something is wrong with the keg he said. Time to go, not interested in ordering food. waiting another 15 minutes to try and pay our bill. The manager finally walked by and asked if everything was ok. She didn't know their specials either. Definitely won't be back.

eI95yZl_IW9vAsvZ2m2Q9w.text: The food was bland and mediocre. The service was OK and the music was alright. They probably make their money off of drinks. The food would be better if I were drinking.

o7vMuqZd6gxQmd8Ph6s6NQ.text: highly suggest salt! At westgate! Jessa and Danielle are the two best VIP girls on the entire  west side! They have always taken care of my group! I have gotten VIP service making sure both of them were my VIP girls because they are so good at what they do and they make sure your entire group is having/making a great memory!

d6UQNvWTtslcwnaadxFMrQ.text: Came in today for some taco Tuesday! We got the ground beef tacos & carne asada taco. The tacos are soft shell. They were good. We also got the nachos & added the carne asada(it's about $3 more). The nachos are huge! 4 or more people and definitely share. Wish they layered the toppings cause only the top has lots of stuff but not the bottom chips. The cheese is really good. We also ordered the buffalo wings. They were delicious & 8 comes in a order. Their margaritas are very colorful and look awesome! My brother likes the house margarita, it was a bit to strong for my taste(but I'm not a drinker).   On Tuesday's they have taco specials.   They do have an upstairs & a patio as well. The menu was a bit to hard to read cause some of the print came off or it's small writing & there's a design behind the words you can't even read.

X0UkIb6uUVp16QlFYpM5hg.text: Salt is a great place to spend Saturday dinner, especially if you are into soccer.  It's a lively venue, the Estrella Jalisco girls were wandering around passing out swag, and the items we ordered were delicious.   The dip trio had reallly nice, with great guacamole.   I had a carnitas burrito with habanero pineapple salad that was perfect.  I recommend it heartily!

PO8RE4JokVdERkuYegoKsw.text: The staff was good. The beer and house margarita was great but the guacamole had no flavor, the beans were from a can and the salsa was very watery. I usually don't salt my food but this definitely needed salt a lots of it. We had the three taco combo the carnitas was good had better, fish taco had too much breading on the fish and potato taco didn't have enough potato's in it. It wasn't the worst but could be better.

fCFPLrM33zKRJxkQIsDU_w.text: We decided to eat here before Garth Brooks.   This area is cRaZy & the line for Salt wrapper around the building & we got there 4 hours before the concert even started!   It took about an hour to get seated & we were cool with that... expected.     As soon as we were seated our server was there & he said he realized we'd be there for awhile so let him know when we needed anything else.   I thought that was awesome!!   I mean most servers want to bump you out for the next table.      It was loud in there.    Maybe just a preconcert party.   It was awesome but if you want a quiet place where you can have great conversations maybe don't stop in here before a show.     We ordered the nachos first.   THEY WERE AMAZING.   I think we got carne asada on them.   If this place wasn't so far we'd go back for those nachos ALL THE TOME!   And it was huge!   Four of us ate it all but I was sooooo full.     But if you are in the area I would definitely make this my pick!

cBlQqnOIQyELvMSxr9U3ZQ.text: Friendly and attentive staff. Generous chef let us sample veggies with no charge. Chips and salsa were very good. Taco plates were typical street tacos. Potato tacos were pretty greasy but had that yummy crunch to them. We would return and try other items on the menu next time. Fun location.

uMdlphyrzqjl5tI9c2L0oQ.text: I don't know what's worse??? The smell of the restrooms, or the smell of all the stank after hours!!! They need to provide with all them $5 cover charges a travel size deodorant for all them musty people!!! I can't and won't!! PEROIDT!!!!

OSRc3pHUIYdUkpUcqfdM-w.text: We were so looking forward to trying this place today, but it was a let down.  After sitting at a table In the bar for nearly 15 minutes no one even said hello.  No someone will be with you. Nothing. Not even a menu. The whole time servers were helping people around us.  It was t busy at all. Maybe 10 tables seated.   The entire time the hostess was looking over at us with an I'm oblivious  to the rest of the world look.    I can't comment on the food because we left. Didn't even get a lol at the menu.    On the way out I told the hostess to let her manager know we hadn't even received as much as a simple hello in the 15 minutes since we walked in.  The little self absorbed Twit actually laughed.    I will never go back. This place needs a new manager before it sinks.   We walked to another restaurant, greeted at the door, seated right away, menus and drinks in less than a minute.

wJYubqkau-yqVLMUM5iEjg.text: While visiting a girlfriend in Arizona we stopped by here on a Saturday night. We took an Uber so not sure how the parking is when it's busy.   When we first got there it was still early so the DJ wasn't set up yet. First impression was that it's a pretty huge restaurant and bar area. Indoor and outdoor seating is available.   We left and stopped by a few other places then came back later when the DJ started to play music. Thankfully we didn't have to wait in line that long because as the night went on the line got crazy long!   Bathrooms didn't have any paper towels...and that was the case early on before it got really packed. Drinks were alright...seemed a little weak for my liking lol but we were already buzzed so maybe it was just me. So, that's why it's a 3 star rating.  Overall experience was so much fun. DJ was really good. We pretty much danced all night...music was really good but anytime with the girls is good times...  I'm sure we will visit here again when I come to visit!

mZ3gMHH723Flr8KfHklLuw.text: Stopped in for lunch before the Lions vs Cardinals game and chose this place because they had some vegetarian and GF options. I enjoyed my veggie burrito, simple ingredients, but tasty. It was $13 and served with rice and beans. My wife ordered the nachos and they were severely lacking cheese and toppings. More than half of the chips did not have cheese or toppings on them. Her nachos we're $14 and not worth it. Service was below average. I understand they were busy because of the game, but you have to at least act like you care.

2wPt-YdPtEQHg8mFvY-cLg.text: Davian rocked out! We had the coolest server, ever!   My daughter and I decided to check out Taco Tuesday at Salt and was not disappointed with the $1, yes $1 Ground Beef Tacos. They also offer potato and veggie tacos for that price point. For $2 and $3, you had other types of tacos available.  Classic Margaritas are $8 but with Happy Hour, it is $2 off. I got mine with salted rim and blended so that raised the price. My drink was still very delicious and the tequila was nice and smooth.  We also ordered the hulking Salt nachos ($15) with carne asada ($3). It was well worth the price. They give a generous amount of home marinated steak. It has a nice tang and citrus finish. Wow! They melt shredded cheddar and cojita (maybe). It also has pickled sliced jalapeno, black beans and pico de gallo. You are a guacamole lover, you get 2 oz. for $3 more.   Davian took care of us, and were more than pleased with our meal and service. Thank you, Salt!

Photo of Salt Tacos y Tequila - Glendale, AZ, United States. Blurry Taco Tuesday Menu

iNMAN1_eKN6Crv8oOa7T0A.text: Seated outside which was not a problem however, waited about 10 min then finally got up and left, not one person came to our table.  Only after we started walking out did someone ask if we had been served.  Will not return.

GFEDZTgdKVqsnGj8g8Ajug.text: We decided to stop in at Salt Tacos y Tequila after the end of the Coyotes/ Red Wings hockey game last weekend for a post game drink. I have not felt more disappointed in a restaurant experience in a while than I did with Salt. We were shuttled upstairs to a part of the restaurant that had almost no ventilation and zero viewing, despite that many tables were open downstairs and on the 'outdoor' area. Our waiter got to us pretty quickly and was friendly enough. We ordered two margaritas; a Michelob Ultra and my daughter who's not quite at the age to embide asked for a Prickly Pear virgin margarita. Our waiter informed us that , he 'could do that, but it would be the same price as a normal margarita'. What? Come again? My husband asked if he could have the tequila on the side then, since we were paying 10.50 for a virgin drink sans alcohol. He said , 'only if I charge you for the shot of tequila'. Did this make sense to anyone ? No. To be honest, I don't think it's legal to do that, either. Charging for an alcoholic beverage with no alcohol??? Make me understand how basically prickly pear kool aid minus alcohol is worth more than a few bucks? It's interesting that any other restaurant does this with a smile or recommends something else. His attitude was truly getting to me, after he said , 'well, the restaurant just wants you to order the actual drink, not make some virgin drink..', as he shrugged. Nice. I reluctantly ordered but would have left after that had we not been with two other people. We also ordered nachos to share and lemons to go with our waters, to which he said , 'that'll be awhile , as I have to go downstairs to get the lemons'. Several minutes later the lemons appeared and one had been squeezed; just gross. Our 10.50 margarita / non margarita and 11.00 cucumber margarita arrived in small plastic cups laden with tons of ice. My husband's beer didn't appear to be a pint in that small cup! How are you serving people in plastic cups and charging this much for drinks ? We aren't on spring break in some beach town! Again, wanting to cancel this nacho order and just leave , we didn't. The nachos arrive and they were okay but not anything to go nuts over. They were an ample serving but not filled with toppings for all the chips. 2 margaritas ; a domestic beer ; one virgin margarita ( full price as with tequila ) ; plate of non meat nachos - 60+ dollars .. all with mediocre to minus service. Trust me. This is great complex of cool bars and restaurants with actual glassware and great customer service.. just not here. Return factor- zero point zero zero.

ZD-VpXYwYXL0DotO9aSUKA.text: A great drink menu. Margaritas are delicious! I had the chimichanga and it was super good. Another time I had the chicken quesadilla, which is on the starters but is definitely enough for a meal

89MEcj2ennsBXKkNyfVsyg.text: Came here with some work friends and had a good meal. It's in a cool area right near the stadium with all a lot of options.   We had various things and all of the portions were really big.  I had the build the bowl which was a really cool option.  The carnitas in my bowl had good flavor and would like to try something different if I am ever back in the area.  Everyone seemed to like their food.  Salads, Burritos, build a bowl and tacos were among the things we ordered.    Service was good.  Not over the top but just solid.  We sat outside and it was nice to enjoy a beautiful night in Arizona.    Good option if you are in the area.

uFt66uIjmEqKFmS1F5PhtA.text: We recently had a large party of over 20 people at this restaurant.  Despite the fact that this was an event night at Westgate, our waitress Bre was awesome and did a fantastic job taking care of everyone.  The food and drinks were pretty good overall.  I knocked down some stars because the manager(s) failed. We booked a table for our large party weeks in advance, only to be told they couldn't find a reservation at the door.  As a result our group was split and our friend with the wheelchair was unable to join us due to the tall bar tables. Bad experience for taking a large group of people to this restaurant.

pvuT7pm-alqCWsR_H75-bw.text: Our server was fantastic! I didn't catch his name but he was great at keeping our party of 7 updated with our food status and drinks filled. I took his recommendation on my margarita and food. My margarita was blood orange but I couldn't taste any tequila at all. My food was a carnitas chimichanga. It was good but kind of bland a d had a lot of pork fat in it. The side of rice and beans were pretty good. We also had the trio appetizer and I really enjoyed the queso. The guac I didn't have and the salsa was just meh to me.

wWk47ptQGCHZiXtlpE5xOA.text: I haven't been to Westgate often, but glad I got to experience this place. We decided to come here after a Spring training game. The restaurant was super accommodating. We had a large party and just showed up. They sat us right away, our server was the best (Tyler I think) and the manager stopped by a few times to check on us.   I always appreciate good service in a restaurant. And Salt certainly delivered. We did order some apps, however they didn't blow my mind. Which is the only reason they aren't getting 5 stars. But if you have never been, please check this place out. You will not be disappointed. I have been back since that first visit, and will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt Tacos y Tequila - Glendale, AZ, United States

C6vBY1or4ya46r5e2H7FOA.text: I want to give a 2 star, I really do, but as you read on, you'll see it's probably just 1.  The main reason - poorly managed!!  My family and I came here THE DAY BEFORE Cinco De Mayo, for my mom's birthday.  I called earlier in the week to make a reservation.  When my parents showed up before my husband and I, they said they didn't have my reservation.  I guess the hostess gave a little attitude about it but quickly changed her tune.  It was packed in there (there had been a motorcycle rally as well as a concert about to start at the arena next door), so they sat us upstairs, first in some dusty booth, then in the corner of their upstairs loft, by a bar that didn't have a tender.  We ordered 4 drinks and 3 shots, and our dinners.  They gave us complimentary guac and salsa with chips to offset the losing of the reservation.    THIRTY minutes later, our FOOD came out.  Where's the drinks? We asked.  Finally some busser brought our beverages about 10 minutes after we got our food.  They must have heard our grumbling, on top of our waitress yelling at her manager about how poorly the night was being run there, because a manager came to our table to apologize and offered to comp our drinks.  Our waitress was very sweet but unfortunately spread thin due to how busy it was.  This restaurant was not prepared, but I'm curious - they ARE aware of local events going on, AND it was CINCO DE MAYO, AND they're a MEXICAN restaurant!  HOW do you NOT prepare for that??  Waitress definitely had our best interest, and like I said, tore her manager a new one saying that waiting that long for food/drinks is unacceptable.  I guess they only had TWO bartenders working and the waiters had to get in line to submit their drink orders.  WTF??  I felt so bad for my mom because I PICKED this place to bring her and the family for her birthday dinner.  She said it would make for a funny story years to come.  Best part - comped drinks.  Worst part - everything else, ESPECIALLY POOR PLANNING ON MANAGEMENT'S PART!!

zYqyqENMNHcEdOjS6OgqHg.text: Oskar is the best bartender @ Westgate!!! He gave me everything I asked for and More!!!

32iBTQw7c_VZdZMCFM3E8w.text: Saturday I went with my family and ordered the tacos the portions were a good size and the food was delicious!!!!! Will be returning again!!!!! Highly recommend

_V_cA91Yzo_HpYNurFagKg.text: Really enjoyed the guacamole & salsa appetizer.  Carne asada tacos were quite good, too.  Even enjoyed the side rice & beans.    Sorry, can't review drinks, didn't have any.  Good place for pre-game.  My 5 year is tugging on my arm and wants me to add the kids quesadilla & fries were excellent but there was a fly in the restaurant.

YH-HG0gO-ujmqLlZwAoQ0A.text: Came in today because I was wandering around west gate with a friend trying to figure out where to eat. I'm a sucker for taco Tuesday so I decided to try this place out. $1, $2, and $3 street tacos, a pretty good steal when they're normally $14 for three tacos (ridiculous and would never pay that much). Anyways, I got the veggie, Barbacoa, and Baja fish tacos. Veggie was weird, it had broccoli and cauliflower in it? No flavor, glad it was only the $1 taco. Fish was cod, not a bad taco but it was cold so wasn't good either. The barbacoa one was good. The meat was flavorful and the sauce mixed well with it. Wish I would've gotten three of those.  Overall, would come back if I'm desperate for a $1 taco but I think I can find much much much better tacos elsewhere.

huV5UtvMTtQ8LcWbGajfXw.text: We went to salt today for lunch. I have never had such horrible service at a restaurant. We sat there for 45 minutes before anyone took our order. We asked 4 different servers to help us and get us drinks. Finally someone came over. It took about 40 minutes to get our food. The tacos were okay.   It definitely wasn't worth the two hours we spent there for a couple of tacos.

JZDeG8EehpagwvwS-mojzQ.text: Me and some of my family walked into this place to have some drinks before went over to the Cardinals game this past Saturday. Not to mention tacos have amazing flavor!! My new fav spot for TacoTuesday!!  Ask for Crystals  section she really makes your experience great !!

4QhBey1q0FeoNXGl35MNXw.text: So rarely do I come here for food, I typically come for the music/drinks and just to have a good time in the wonderful atmosphere Salt provides week in and week out. I had the nachos for the first time and they were pretty legit but I mostly came here to let everyone know how satisfied I was with the service that was provided from one of the servers working that night. She went by Bre B. And oh boy did she make our night extremely special. Very attentive waitress, kept the laughs going for our table all night and never once did we feel uncomfortable asking for anything as she was the most genuine waitress I've ever had the pleasure of serving me. I will definitely be back and hope to be seated in which ever area she's tending to. She made our typical experience feel very homey and I was glad to give her a generous tip. I do hope this young lady gets to move up And forward and that she's promoted to something higher than she is now because she has that serving thing in the bag! Epic experience!

NTWBPR3i8WOXpd4_QCOYFg.text: Mass produced Mexican food at a high price. The location was great, but the quality and taste of food was a great disappointment. Chicken burrito was a few pieces of dried out chicken and 2 pounds of white rice rolled into a soft shell. The beer prices are way too high. A great place to sit and have water and take in the atmosphere, but not a place to eat and drink... great disappointment.

3IeQFZlmWFqkGtbpqH3uTA.text: Located in the westgate complex, salt -y advertises great margueritas and exceptional service. Both are somewhat dubious claims.  After a long wait, we were eventually seated in the outdoor/patio area. After an even longer wait, the drinks finally arrived but were less than stellar. Sent the first order back...tried again for a basic marguerita which was weak and watered-down. Requested a nacho order which looked rather large (at first glance) but turned out to be mostly stale chips with minimal sauce. The waiters were friendly but seemed to have difficulty grasping the concept of their job positions. Atmosphere :  ambience is lacking and is basically just another bar located in or near a mall complex.

M4bjlOuMsAXeKLkRmQnChA.text: My boyfriend and I went to Westgate for the first time in 10 years to have dinner at Salt's. What a great experience.  Great food, drinks, and service. Westgate looks really good!

SNV6ufcrvWOG26zX-MH1yg.text: Its spring training weekend and we came to this location for happy hour.  Tyler our waiter, exceeded himself with his charismatic personality  and great customer service.  He kepted up with our drink reguest service and brought out our food promptly.  We leave Salt being happy customers.. Thanks Tyler!

Z1x5rkhrFbocJAa2k_Qljw.text: Had lunch there today. With the tip about 50 bucks. Mediocre food mediocre service and way overpriced.

4JKcDG9H4OwI5cxOHFjZCw.text: For a place called 'Salt' I found it odd that arriving at 9:30 (they close at 10) that the bar staff had already put away the margarita salt!  The second we walked in the unfriendly bartender let us know that the kitchen was closed.  That's fine, but we still wanted a drink.  Sitting there, a couple dozen other people came in (a Coyote's game ended about 9:30) and were ignored by the staff, which was too busy cleaning so that they could leave ASAP at 10.    The margarita that I did have (with no salt!) was actually pretty darn good and would garner a 4 or 5 star rating!  There are plenty of other bars open in the Westgate area, and after leaving Salt, spent several more hours in the area at bars that were open, serving food and full of people!

BxZoHKHqgENpPGCa6L1iEQ.text: Marcus and Junior literally provided the worst customer service ever. They are so disrespectful they told my cousin she had a funny looking face and that she shouldn't come in as often. Rudest guys ever!!!!!! Never coming back to this place because of these two guys. Second time we came in Marcus said "You look Mexican as fuck" to my boyfriend and didn't let us in because he "didn't belong there" when we told him we were writing a review about him he said "well idc I'm not losing my job over you losers" so sad that Salt hires people like these two guys. I will definitely pass the work onto all of our friends.

nUmaUEKqLSG8JU_wyi-4ww.text: I do not understand why so many people gave this  place such low ratings.   I recently was visiting Arizona and wanted to try Mexican before leaving. We were near west gate and this was our only options and hesitant because of the reviews.   I think the salsa makes or breaks a Mexican joint! The salsa was flavorful with a minor kick to it. I personally enjoy spicier stuff, but understand not all people do therefore feel the salsa was pretty great.  In ordered the chicken tacos were great! I didn't need to add any salsa or hot sauce to them, usually a sign that I feel the food has no taste or a bad one.    Only downside was being not busy at all the waitress did not come by for long periods of times!

07FADE7N0UK8Wtus7I2KQA.text: Its another one of these places at westgate, they want to have an interrogation at the door about how drunk you are, I had to recite my address on my id, let them know everywhere I'd been tonight and then pay a cover, but everyone after the security guy was really nice.  I'm happy to be here, it's a cool spot, and I guess it's safe if they're being so rude at the door, but I mean don't show up drunk, you're not gonna get in. I like hip hop and I'm 27 so overall satisfied, they weren't hounding me about money when I got my drink so it's not too bad, but really if you have the choice, I recommend going somewhere else.  I'd be happy coming here if it was the last bar left on earth, but if you're in the Phoenix area there's so many other options.  I came here on a sunday before the Final 4 last game and nobody was here.  They even booked DJ Green Lantern who I've seen pack XS in Las Vegas on a Monday.  I started begging people on Periscope and Snapchat to come by but ultimately they cancelled his appearance.  This place is a joke, the people who run it only keep it going because there are so many tourists.  I can't wait until the Coyotes leave and all these whack Westgate bars just fail, I'm gonna laugh myself to sleep that night.

t188ifSMODG-wU10MKo3hQ.text: I have has pretty good experiences in the past. This time not so much.   Let me set the stage ... there were 4 table with people, that's it, 4. I arrived at 11:45am and I can't tell you how long I waited to be asked about a drink.   My friends arrived around 12:05. Again, we waited a very long time for the waitress to greet them.   There seemed to be some training going on that day so lots of staff running around but no one being serviced. Two different tables yelled out "can we please order"   We didn't get items we ordered (like soup) .... silverware had to be asked for after the food was dropped off.   Waitress apologized when she dropped off the check about lack of service bringing up that they were learning the registers.   As I said, service was most certainly better in past visits. Food is good. Worth a visit but this time around ... not great in regards to service. Training of registers should not impact my dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt Tacos y Tequila - Glendale, AZ, United States. Wall art

LaroK6WVWDCAKx3wjE4eKw.text: Attention to detail is not this restaurants strong suit, we asked for no cheese on the beans due to a dairy allergy. When beans were brought out with cheese we had to send them back.   We just got our food, and the waiter asked how it was tasting- even though we'd not yet had a chance to take a bite.   When we arrived there was only two tables seated in our section including us- our server was very slow at coming back asking for drink and food orders.   The women's restroom was disgusting- sinks had rust and black mold on them. Toilet paper all over the floor of the stalls- I'm sure this hadn't been cleaned on a daily or hourly basis. It was gross.   This place charges $5 for chips and salsa- this is pretty basic at any Mexican restaurant and any of them that charge for something like that immediately is a red flag for me.   I think there is much this restaurant could improve on- our waiter although friendly was not attentive or paid attention to detail. Even though he wrote down our order on his pad, he still got it wrong. Not sure we will be back.

sKjSAOXKnhM-tbwKRaREXA.text: I swear it is very difficult to find a decent "Mexican restaurant "... Salt hit the spot today for my family. We came in today during lunchtime they don't have any lunch specials from what I noticed today. I think the only downside is they charge you five dollars for chips and salsa I think that's pretty stupid. Like I get it the chips and salsa are super good. you have blue corn and you have a red chip awesome but you don't need to be charging for chips and salsa should totally be complementary. As for food I got the chipotle coconut shrimp tacos. The only downside is the tacos completely fall apart. Rice and beans pretty basic. The carne Asada tacos were OK I don't really prefer a sweet marinade on my tacos. But they were still very tasty.  I don't know what type of environment this place is at night time but for lunch with kids it definitely seems like an ideal place to go grab some lunch.

nSPpkABVxrmOMkzx5Vku2A.text: My wife and I love this place for their gluten free options.  I wanted to give 3.5 stars because their service is horrible if you don't sit at the bar.  We went up to the hostess desk and they sat us in the far corner patio.  Not a single person acknowledged us. We went to the bar and immediately got drinks and appetizers.  Try the shrimp tacos and the carne tacos they are the best.   We have been here 5-6 times and now always sit at the bar.  Wine selection is ok but they have great appetizers and beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt Tacos y Tequila - Glendale, AZ, United States. Ultra

8MM-jEfBDRi6UJcZHKu1NA.text: I came here with some friends before the Childish Gambino Concert at the Gila Arena. We were seated right away outside. They tried to get a heater for us on, but it didn't work, which was kinda a bummer. I was kinda cold. Our waiter was alright, he didn't really check on us that much.   First we ordered drinks and then our entrees. I just got a soda, some chips and salsa for the table and their enchiladas with carne asada. We got the chips and salsa first and those weren't bad. They were a good filler while we waited for our food. When my entree came out I was kinda confused. It didn't look like an enchilada at all. It was a few flat corn tortillas with cheese in the middle, carne asada thrown on top and some red sauce and more cheese to top it off. it wasn't that bad taste wise, I just don't think it looked like an enchilada at all. This place was just alright.

BUEtOTYsDyLHnAEV1E2i1Q.text: So I've been here at night to dance the night away but I've never eaten here and boy have I missed out.  I had a potato taco, shredded chicken and carne asada taco. All of the tacos were good but the Potato Taco is my new favorite.  Our water was so much fun and took really great care of us. The martinis are really good as well  Overall we had a blast

af1Y8bBFgHu67VHNrOgD6A.text: I love colorful chips! And it's downhill from there: I very much dislike leaving bad reviews but customer service to our friends and us was exceptional. When it was mildly amusingly bad she was simply acting disinterested or disgruntled at being asked for anything, and we asked for normal things like water when she'd asked. There reason however for 2 starts instead of 3, because my friends all enjoyed their meals, was that my plate of $13 nachos had cheese only on most of the top layer chips. It was an impressive amount of chips that towered tall and looked impressive but once I ate one chip I could see the plate was nothing more than an illusion of grandeur. Those cheese covered chips were delicious mind you, but but a sampling of the meal I desired.   It ended up being fine because if they had been thoroughly delicious nachos apart from the two I could've eaten more than a small appetizer portion and gained weight (sarcasm if you couldn't tell), so maybe they should get more stars for forcing me to keep my figure lol. Anyhow, my friends liked their food and less than 1/4 or 1/5 could be called nachos. The jalapenos were good though. At the end I had two (yes two) large, very full plates of empty, sad looking naked chips. As much as I dislike leaving a poor score on a restaurant, especially since my friends enjoyed their food despite their treatment prior to our arrival, I don't believe in wasting food. They were trying to over sell something and completely under delivered what was purchased.   Moral of story is if you want nachos, wait and go somewhere else. Though the top 10 chips were pretty good... Plus like 2 on the bottom... If you still go here because you're going to a game and craving nachos I'd suggest ordering the side of chips and add cheese and jalapenos and you'll get the same amount while saving significant money. Winning. Though with their service you might be lucky to get your chips.   Decent menu though so next time we're there for a game I might try one of the other dishes and see if they redeem themselves. Plus the servers can't all be like the one we had. Can they?

photos.caption: Photo of Salt Tacos y Tequila - Glendale, AZ, United States. 1/4th of my nachos &amp; 3rd of the ones w/o any toppings. Should&#39;ve gotten the side of chips and dip instead, &amp; prevented the excessive waste.

gs2vy1ZRZSiOnl_AaUKu5A.text: Food is good here I loved it! But Saturday nights DJ is not so great. We went for more of hiphop night and it was mostly techno which was disappointing. But me and my ladies likes coming here so! We hope next time is better

KLCVzpPzS3TVNSWY0ivJ6w.text: The nachos at this bar is huge and really good . We was there before the rush and it was perfect bar seating and fast service . They need Hendricks gin . But other then that we liked it and will be back.      Oh the nachos are big enough or 4 people.

Ad1zJV7kR5G9Xx99_z0uSw.text: Attempted to have dinner tonight. Was sat in a back corner on the patio where I was ignored by the service staff for twenty minutes. Needless to say I gave my money to Yard House instead.

ipmfiL0SQn2393RslgWbHg.text: So, I was here on a busy night, and I'm a vegan, so fine if they screw up.   For other vegans reading this-- the rice and beans have chicken broth and animal fat.   Two vegan orders came out w cheese, sour cream, and chicken broth / meat fat sides that we *asked about first * and were served anyway.     But someone else in our party ordered shrimp tacos.   Complete mess that fell apart and had one small shrimp smaller than a quarter.   Then they served a margarita but forgot the tequila.   Others in the party ordered nachos and 40 minutes later they haven't shown up.   This place is a joke.

_jvRTt3N08wKclJ2YWZC6Q.text: I had to change my review due to my last visit on Tuesday. Taco Tuesday! Anyways the last Time good was good not this time. V3WFXYBygZhmAuQ8mu-kuw.text: The Westgate area restaurants are pretty slow at lunch during the week and this was no exception.   We were greeted by our waiter Cody, who was very friendly and informative.  Having never dined here we had a bunch of questions.  He was very good at pointing out several of the top favorites.   We had the Pancho Villa Burger and the Chipotle Coconut Shrimp Tacos. Both dishes were on spot!   We did see a table with the Nachos and they were huge.  We are excited to go back and try a couple of different options.  Thank you for the great food and service!

8rc5VbXDpnN9M0AzXcGMkA.text: When the 'yotes game ended and we saw this place had lots of available tables when there were literally thousands of people milling about, we should have taken a hard pass.  But instead of being smart, I said hey, look that place has lots of seating available, let's duck in and wait out the Uber surge.     We ordered the nachos and they were alright.   A few burnt chips but overall everyone seemed to enjoy them.     I'm no stranger to expensive cocktails....but $11 margaritas served in plastic cups?  NOPE.    I AM a stranger to virgin drinks....but a virgin 1800 Reposado Prickly Pear margarita served without the 1800 Reposado is just prickly pear syrup and lime juice....except they refused to serve my daughter the drink unless we paid the full $10.50 price...and then when my thoughtful wife had the IMHO great idea for them to bring me the tequila on the side, our server refused unless we paid another $7 for a shot.     So, to be clear, 1800 Reposado is listed on the menu at $7.   The 1800 Reposado Prickly Pear marg is $10.50.  The value of the prickly pear and lime juice is, therefore, $3.50.  But if I wanted the prickly pear syrup and lime juice in a plastic cup with ice, and the 1800 on the side, the magic number became $17.50.  And the server wasn't budging, so short of escalating that nonsense in front of my family....I decided enough dwelling.   Also, my wife asked for lemon wedges to go with her water.   Server brought a little cup of them out after 15 minutes or so, and one of them had been squeezed already.  Bleh.

r06zzn14CXkJUdGOhBYa4w.text: 9/3 mid day The waitress had a seriously bad attitude for no reason. Also, the huge guy who came out from the back and brought our food did too and argued about how there was no salsa on the tacos we ordered even though its right there on the menu. Then some guy showed up, very nice and asked us how things were I think he was a manager then what do you know everyones attitude changed just by him being there. The meat on all the tacos were dry and seemed old, its always like this Ive been here more than once. Thanks for the shits. Im not going back.

5AMu9g87fXc93D86RZ0uXg.text: My only complaint about this place was the volume of the game that was on. We asked if it could be turned down a bit and it was. The food was great. Some of the best salsa I've ever had. Our server was great too.

j3Nh5X3TGFFCUSuMGD5Ang.text: I've been to Salt a couple times on the weekend during the night life but never to eat. My boyfriend and I decided to try it out for sate night.  I ordered a BUILD A BOWL, same idea as chipotle. I had it with chicken. It ran about $12 for the bowl and they totally skimped out of the lettuce and the rice was a little mushy. YR63AehKZ4eFzE19jbR1kA.text: We had a delightful experience here before the Cards game. Beer was cold, waitress awesome, and nachos piled to the roof--for the HALF order! Can only imagine the full size. Margaritas were top-notch.

FarofOQ99ly-TuwwkKTnew.text: A big group of friends and I went to Salt Tacos y Tequila before and after the LSU victory @ the Fiesta Bowl.  The place was very busy, and all of the staff was friendly and courteous.  We got our food and drinks at the bar, and the food was delicious and service was prompt, in spite of the huge crowd.  The staff seemed happy.  We felt like we were celebrating at home in Baton Rouge, with all of the LSU tunes they played and the LSU decor everywhere!  What a great memory!

ZTmkD8BGuZ1eeaQheLjLjA.text: Thought we would experience the local Mexican dining this afternoon while visiting Arizona.  We were immediately put off walking in the door by several people at a table having loud horns that they were continuously blowing.  It sounded like a group of whales dropping their mating calls..  There was also a live DJ playing music quite loudly that it was like being in a club at 2pm which is comical at best.  After debating for a short time of whether to just leave we decided to give the place a chance.  Due to the soccer game that would be taking place in the evening we continuously had people approaching our table peddling off Modelo brand items constantly.    We ordered a half order of nachos for the appetizer, the chili verde burrito, chicken breast entree and carne asada enchiladas.  The nachos showed up and they were huge, overall they were pretty good.  However the waitress told us our food was coming right out while placing the nachos on our table so there are some timing issues to be worked out.  The individual with the enchiladas said they were pretty good minus the steak being thrown on top instead of actually being inside the enchiladas themselves.  The chili verde burrito I ordered turned out to be a large white rice burrito with a little bit of meat and chili verde sauce, and lastly the chicken breast entree was pointed out to be the same thin pre-cooked chicken breasts we had picked up in the frozen section at the grocery store for some quick meals at work.  Overall I'd say the food was mediocre at best, the constant barrage of people approaching the table including the waitress not being attentive to a group of three this place was pretty much a bust.  The final hit for the place that was surprising was automatic gratuity for a group of three people!    I recommend trying another Mexican restaurant before wasting your money here unless you're going for the music/loud environment.

2BBxMEG0oh-hpnvkrFgi7g.text: I really wanted to like this place, but too many mistakes were made to give this a better review. We were seated quickly and the waiter brought water and menus promptly. However, that was as good as it got. The margaritas were brought without salt even though we both requested salted rims, so they needed to be repoured. The waiter was too busy to pay us much attention, but when he was there, he was knowledgeable about the menu. The food was good, I ordered the shrimp tacos, which were sweet (unexpected, but good), and barbacoas, which was quite spicy. The waiter disappeared for a while and when he returned with our checks, they were wrong and had to be redone... twice. The bathroom was not clean, one stall out of order. Really no reason for me to go back, even if I lived locally.

D5Q-o8mrYFC5bMGNxKipKg.text: Got food and it was cold. I asked new rice, bean and burrito.  I got new rice and bean are hot but the burrito was cool.  I got sick from the food in about 4 hours later.  Waitress was awful as he always forget and goofed up too many times no refill water or check.  Poor food and service.

HptmMPpTAMoMJWduropAag.text: We ran here to escape the rain for the beerfest.  Quickly seated next to an outdoor heater as we requested.  Service was spot on.  Our friends ordered the nachos app.  The most enormous plate of food I think I've ever seen.  Tasty too.  The hit of the night was the tamales.  I've had homemade tamales and these were unbelievable.  Perfectly cooked with the masa not the highlight but just a perfect partner to the meat.  Honestly surprised at how good this was. Restaurant tamales aren't usually this good.  A shitty beerfest was rescued by a fantastic evening here.  Thanks!

Definetly enough for 2 people, the fajitas are also on point... great drink specials and its located in the westgate district , at night it comes to life with dj and music, i enjoy coming out here and also the food menu !!

v5utg_R0PTv5bkPopOzoMA.text: I am in town attending a convention and walked over to check things out. Upon entry Lila greeted me and agreed to let me see a menu. I was seated promptly and Lila was my server. I told her this was my first time and she walked me through everything. I know I am pretty particular. I decided try the chips and salsa with queso fundido as an appetizer. For my entree I had the enchiladas with chicken adobo(seasoned perfectly) and I added shrimp. I opted to go with the green sauce (which was a bit too full of lime for me). Nevertheless I ate most of it. I also used a Groupon which the manager had to redeem. He was great as well, made sure everything was great. If I ever visit again, I will definitely stop in, next time during happy hour.

m9rjYSzmaymyFrZhrDyrcg.text: I took the girlfriend there last night and walked into a beautiful restaurant even with the upstairs closed off. They seated us looking right at the fountains in the courtyard and so the ambience was exciting. However as others have mentioned, a Mexican restaurant that doesn't provide chips and salsa wouldn't be someplace I'd repeatedly go to. On a Wednesday night the place had barely 10 customers. Our waitress was training another girl. After ordering a "Hawaiian" drink that claimed to have silver tequila in it (which I could taste the cheapness) and was less than enjoyable. I ordered the lobster taco and was told by the waitress they don't serve that any longer. Really? Couldn't even sharpie it out on the menu? Then we ordered the stuffed tomitillos and they were beautiful but miniature and undercooked. After deciding on the the shrimp tacos for an entree my girlfriend ordered something that resembled a loaded quesodilla. Both were delicious. The bill came to 77 dollars which I thought was criminal. I'd go back but only on a special occasion.

thrpjub81rBbpK5yCU-DQw.text: We live very close to Westgate but hadn't been there in a very long time. We didn't realize that Salt was even there until they hosted an event for our kids school. Each time our service and food have been excellent, and we've tried everything on the menu!

ZfliiiMTpDhzSMJDr4hnCQ.text: This place is a joke. We go out on a Thursday night for a few drinks after spending time on the West side of town (Live the central/Biltmore area). This was the first place we arrived at. All 5 of us Late 20s early 30s showed security our IDs. Went to the bar ordered some drinks for 4 of us, paid the bill and right after i give my receipt to the bar tender I was approached by an over weight Hispanic male claiming he was security. Asked me to step a side and talk to him. He tells me that his boss informed him to ask us to leave cause we are over intoxicated. LOL I inform the man this was our first place and that one of our friends is Pregnant and is not drinking. He insisted that we have been drinking and needed to go. I asked to speak with the guy who pointed us out but he refused. We were not allowed to finish the drinks i just purchased. As we were leaving the security guard at the front says "Leaving so soon?" I told him we were getting kicked out for being too white, rich and for being sober. He laughed and said "oh that's common here"!  WOW! Reasons I don't go to the west side for anything but football. This place is a joke and I cant wait to see the the next place that comes in and takes over this failed establishment.

VcKNgkXf0Ua5CWC8Wi6pKg.text: Great food and great service from Briana! Manager is always involved to ensure a great experience! Atmosphere is fun too!

4HMijtil_kXP02BOeJjyUg.text: Great service! Very friendly atmosphere. Amazing food! Ruben you are the best!! Collette was extemely attentive and made us feel at home. Will definitely come back anytime!

P9S_3Tm0aVJvTxemFqfeSQ.text: We were kept waiting to be seated for 10 minutes as parties behind us were seated. Finally us and another couple were seated in an area that was just opened up.  Great, except the greeter failed to tell a server that this new area had people seated. Finally after another 10 minutes, we asked the greeter, she had to find a server to work this area. The server moved over and got our drink orders and we did not see her for 5 minutes, So, we left, no one really seemed to care about customers in the front. With all the competition at Westgate, you would think they would try harder. But, first and last time for us. Waited 25 minutes and still never had a drink.

5iInKaMQVtiqhazVQ56ycw.text: We've only had chips and salsa since we arrived because the place is packed - Coyotes game tonight!  The reason for the review is not the food, it's the service. Kyra has been absolutely the best wait person we've had in a long time. She's attentive and observant despite the packed house.  If you go, ask for her!

jU2nNSeKOPNYuqw9BAJoCQ.text: This place is awesome!!! Great service and great food!  The atmosphere is perfect!   We had Margaritas and tacos and both were delicious!  Totally recommend this stop at westgate

dvIqxHYwqf61icgtO_Y2yQ.text: Went here on a date after the Coyotes draft party.   I probably should have went somewhere else after talking to the waiter but I had faith.  I have a serious dairy allergy and he was not even familiar with dairy allergies.  After talking to him 3 times telling him exactly what to do, which should have been a sign for me to leave, I ordered my food.  I believe he used his best efforts.  The food tasted good but there was no guacamole on the carne asada guacamole tacos lol... The portions were real small and I left hungry.  Unfortunately they also did not follow my instructions as I ended up have a bad reaction to the food.   The waiter did his best but who knows what the cook did.  They need to be aware of food allergies they are actually very common.  Luckily mine is not life threatening but someone else could be.  I will not be back.

j9_JidZ0loifHvZ_OSLPgA.text: My first experience here was before a Sunday Night Football Game and I had set my expectations low as every bar in the area had over a hour 30 min wait! Salt was able to sit my party of eight within 20 min and we received great service. They told us going in that food was taking about 30 minutes from when you order it so I enjoyed their honestly. Drinks kept flowing and our server checked back often. It's a very energetic atmosphere with two levels so don't come here if you don't like the noise or the crowds! My table ordered the guac, salsa and cheese dip as an appetizer that came out first with tri colored chips. My bf and I split the carne asada nachos (SO MUCH FOOD) and could barely finish- I recommend like 4 people to finish these bad boys! Others at our table ate the chicken quesadilla or carne burritos and said everything was amazing. I'd definitely come back! I noticed a few reserved tables, even on a game day, so it might be worth looking into...

OdikOQV31nD_FdJIHe6v8Q.text: Super disappointed with the wait staff. We were seated pretty quickly for it being a Friday night but once we were seated, our server never came. A server brought the table next to us their food and even came back later to ask how they were doing. Not once did she even acknowledge that we were even there. We waited for 15 minutes and no one ever came. Either there's not enough staff for a restaurant this size or they just don't know how to handle actually being busy. I can understand a rush and waiters trying to get their tables served but the fact we weren't even acknowledged is unacceptable.

jg7gLZubA38om556HnS7Pg.text: Ate here tonight during the Final 4. Was quickly seated given the time of day, though view of the TV wasn't the greatest until I asked if we could sit at a particular table. Our server Teegan was great and very attentive. Would have liked to see a larger menu, but understandable given the "event" menu. We were still very pleased with our meal choices and service! Will definitely come back!

nzfwswyq_pSCorQN9Fiuhg.text: I ordered their cheese enchiladas and it was nasty. I wished my husband and I would have gone some place else to have dinner. The server did not seem happy to be there. Also, the floor was nasty; my shoes stuck to it and was sticky the remainder of my evening.

xwfcT9b51VxAjd2jZJJRqw.text: Tequila selection, Bueno! Atmosphere, Bueno! Food, no Bueno. Seriously, subpar at best. Worth it for the tequila however if you like a good variety.

_TCgHFXpZPh4DE4q5L3qig.text: I went to salt on 5/13 around 8pm at night. The restaurant was quite crowded and the music was very loud. First off, the hostess asked if we wanted to sit outside. My family and I said "no" because it was 90 degrees out and we were still adjusting to the heat. After saying so the hostess rolled her eyes and sat us at a table. From there our waitress/bartender Cara came to the table. She recommended the margaritas and various appetizers. My family and I were not very hungry so we ordered the ceviche and drinks. Let's just say the ceviche was not very good. It was fresh but lacked acidity and spice. After we ate the ceviche our waitress told us about the late happy hour. She said she would give us a happy hour menu but failed to show up again. We left minutes later. On top of that, there was a gentlemen working in the bathroom handing out soap and asking for tips. This was NOT a five star restaurant people.  Cara was friendly but very inattentive. I would give Salt a 1 star but there was plenty of T&A and sports on TV to keep you entertained. In saying so I give Salt 2 stars. Lots of eye candy, bad wait staff, loud music (terrible DJ), below average food, creeper working the bathroom, and high prices. Total tourist trap.

4zaQOTEMX2Vj3AKvlnL6oA.text: Spent 12.50 on a mug of Shock Top. This bar got me looking around, because obviously I'm at the football stadium, or the beach.

UgJVvNrofkj-QLtvNX5bXw.text: This is the old Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville at Westgate.  I had the sea bass tacos and the meat was rubbery, cool, and bland.  Like some of the other reviews have said if you want a margarita or a beer go for it but if you are looking for Mexican food, this is not the place you want to go to.  Bleh.....

ZNndIAHaWCjQSm3Tvj8EIQ.text: Friends in town at Westgate they wanted to try here for Mexican food I suggested someplace else, everyone disappointed with the service, food and the high cost ...seems like they already raised prices ...Stay away

7_GG7uZ4mJePAI37C3upEg.text: The menu was SO LIMITED and not what they had online.  The fish in the tacos I had was cold and mushy and the dish sat way to long before it came to the table that the tortillas disintegrated when I picked it up to eat them.  I will say that when I mentioned that the tacos were soggy they quickly made a couple more and brought them out, but that didn't make up for the fact that they were unsatisfactory to begin with.  My drink didn't come until I reminded someone else that I had ordered it about 20 minutes ago.  All in all it was just OK, but disappointing nevertheless.  For as much as the meal cost we certainly didn't feel it was worth the money.

KQWvxfKPYMgy4A7EO61oJg.text: Stopped in for a bite since we were staying at the hotel next door and were told to seat ourselves outside on the patio .... Great atmosphere but waited for a very long time to be waited on by servers who walked by our table several times.... Finally left and went next door where we had great food and service.

hUVy8PLWBfUT2Cd3UaLXmw.text: Stay away!!!!!! Was not happy at all with the level of service, especially with me being a fair girl. The wait to be seated was insane then waited over an hour for my food. When it finally came out it was cold! Sent it back and guess what.... It came out cold again! Manager comp'd the bill which is cool! Only issue is I was HUNGRY as hell and no one wanted cold chicken on their Nachos!

a_wfltn4ZVUVx0jPKZCGaA.text: Came here with a couple of friends. Drinks are over priced for the price you are paying you would think you can actually be served in a glass nope-plastic. Service was terrible it was slow and each received food and drinks and different times. We didn't eat at the same time as we were not served timely. Paid our tab and was asked if we wanted out change of $37. Never again.

1ndoAPo4pJww_HXLwq3teQ.text: Happened to be in Glendale at the outlet mall and decided to try this place for lunch!  So happy we did....turns out that it's Taco Tuesday, and they have $1, $2, and $3 street tacos, based on ingredients!!  I had 2 of the ground beef ($1ea) and 2 of the carnita ($2ea).  Both were out of this world!   Service was excellent and very prompt!  Highly recommend this place, and we will definitely be back.....probably next Tuesday!!

xcpPtNGjoUkJYMQQSXLPcg.text: 1st and last time we'll go there, unless it's for a quick margarita or beer before going somewhere else. Service was adequate, there wasn't really anyone else there. Food was mediocre at best.  I did like the indoor/outdoor bar and lots of TVs.

epAqBdiH9PduW0mO5ux3rQ.text: Had 3 drinks and then was cut off for no reason. I am assuming this place doesn't like people to have fun. If you're looking for a good time do not go here

PihhEhzAvFYhnYejZqBdDw.text: I went here over the weekend and had an amazing time! I was craving Mexican food and this place sure did hit the spot! I had Chelsea as my waitress and she was so so sweet and patient. I'll definitely going back to this place again!

QNwHjJSq8XHgUVxJ5uHGgg.text: Just left this place for dinner. Got horrible service. Took forever for the server to come over and even greet us. Asked another server for water and never got it. When our server came he didn't even apologize. My cucumber margarita tasted like a regular one. Our order was incorrect. It was definitely not a good time.

ZuX8Z5RO7uU58g3uFmeq3w.text: Update: They saw my review as soon as it was posted and tried to make it right. It worked a little. I'm giving them 2 additional stars. 1 star for trying even though it was only because of my yelp review....and the waitress seemed apologetic. The second star is for taking around 80$ off our bill.  I plan to move to this area from California, so I'd  consider giving this place another chance.   OLD REVIEW: Paid for V.I.P for the night and not once did we get any extra drinks we asked for (we would have paid extra for them), but was told once our bottle is gone they were going to make us get up so they can resale the booth?  Seriously? Our waitress was nice but slow to come back after asking for multiple drinks from 3 different people.    Birthday girl goes to the bartender to let her know what happens and she calls for security saying bday girl gave attitude? So they kick the bday girl out for explaining what happened.   Bday girl did get to come back in but not after being  blamed for some unknown person throwing up in our booth? Although it wasn't anyone in our party and our waitress confirmed it with security.   This place is hella weird. I'm not from out here but they ruined my sis in law Bday, she cried because she was genuinely trying to have fun and they made her sit outside for 30 min wondering if she could rerurn to our shit V.I.P table. ...over explaining our situation about our lack of service.  As I write this we got a drink finally. Lol. The waitress actually felt bad for us and how we were treated. I thank her, but the bouncer was rude and spoke to us in a disrespectful tone.

h6mzbibiM2PkKexQCsLzYA.text: Excellent selection, great tasting QUALITY Mexican Food! Finally! Glendale has a great Mexican restaurant with good service and awesome location! Will be back! They served our table of eight quickly and with good attitudes!

p7ybzsseTH2bR9g6hyDBYQ.text: Good food and reasonable prices. Ate here prior to Cardinals game and surprisingly got in right away. Service was good even though they were a packed house.

ka8Me4L07Idn508JeHEl-g.text: Nothin' better than the service from Chris at your table or Army at the bar! Hardest working personalities in the area. Seek em' out take care of them and they'll take care of you! Go lions!

-UnVMOelxPBWdnQqmzS6Sw.text: Average Mexican food. It is in the westgate entertainment district which is a fun area to visit. Their happy hour is 3-7pm and a pretty good deal with half off selected appetizers (which is most of them) and some money off of alcoholic drinks (including margaritas and sangria.) Service was good. Many vegetarian options available without the price of a meat entree!  For an appetizer we got the loaded fries which was a lot of food! Definitely order for 3-5 people not 2 people unless it's your meal. For an entree I got the enchilada with red sauce which came with a side of rice and refried beans.

zZd1fgUX714inBCnPMqPpQ.text: Horrible. Birds flying in and out . Lady at the bar brought me a water and asked my partner oh did you want a water too ? Plate was steaming hot and the food was cold .  Water taste like it was from the sewer . Expensive for a bitter taste.

0cZ5ZTSly5cLGtT8AyDJqg.text: Four stars for the food/presentation. Excellent server she said she was new, very attentive. Husband had the tamales. Said best he's ever had or at least second best. I had salad and the shredded beef tacos. SO GOOD!!! The avacado vinagrette dressing was delicious. Had leftovers next day and used that same dressing on some taquitos my husband ate.  Stayed for dancing which didn't start till around 10. One worker after moving tables barely swept floor, super lazy. I guess a fall and injury on food and napkin pieces would change that. Where's management? DJ was really good though.

We opted for the 32oz Kilt Lifter our local fave & shared (if I don't share those big dog beers always heat up on me). The experience was good & we'll be back to check out the nightlife & dinner soon. The prices for the portions that we saw looked pretty good.
